meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the examination of the stomach using a thin, flexible tube with a camera at the end.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a gastroscopic tool to look inside the patient's stomach.
meanings.sent2: The gastroscopic examination revealed the cause of the stomach pain.
meanings.sent3: During the gastroscopic procedure, the camera in the tube captured funny images of the stomach lining.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a gastroscopic camera, capturing every detail of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The gastroscopic view of the stomach was clear and detailed, like a window into the body.

meanings.definition: A medical procedure in which a gastroscopic tube is inserted into the stomach to diagnose or treat conditions.
meanings.sent1: The gastroscopic was used to identify the source of the problem in the patient's stomach.
meanings.sent2: After the gastroscopic, the doctor prescribed the appropriate treatment.
meanings.sent3: The gastroscopic tube felt like a tiny explorer venturing into the unknown depths of the stomach.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a gastroscopic tube, probing deep into the truth of the matter.
meanings.sent5: The gastroscopic procedure provided a direct look at the stomach's inner workings, like a secret revealed.
